meanings.sent1: The rarefied air atop the mountain made me feel light-headed.
meanings.sent2: Her rarefied taste in art led her to collect valuable paintings.
meanings.sent3: The rarefied atmosphere of the fancy gala made me feel out of place.
meanings.sent4: His rarefied intellect allowed him to grasp complex concepts effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The rarefied beauty of the sunset took my breath away.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or interesting to a select group
meanings.sent1: The rarefied club required a special invitation to join.
meanings.sent2: The rarefied topic of quantum physics fascinated the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The rarefied taste of the dish was appreciated by only a few connoisseurs.
meanings.sent4: Her rarefied knowledge of ancient history impressed the scholars.
meanings.sent5: The rarefied world of high fashion can be intimidating to outsiders.

meanings.sent1: The rarefied gas expanded to fill the entire container.
meanings.sent2: The rarefied clouds at high altitudes are wispy and thin.
meanings.sent3: The rarefied milkshake was too watery to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The rarefied atmosphere in the balloon caused it to rise rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The rarefied solution became transparent after the particles settled.
